AxisAngle(float3, Single)

Returns a float4x4 matrix representing a rotation around a unit axis by an angle in radians. The rotation direction is clockwise when looking along the rotation axis towards the origin.

Euler(Single, Single, Single, RotationOrder)

Returns a float4x4 rotation matrix constructed by first performing 3 rotations around the principal axes in a given order. All rotation angles are in radians and clockwise when looking along the rotation axis towards the origin. When the rotation order is known at compile time, it is recommended for performance reasons to use specific Euler rotation constructors such as EulerZXY(...).

Declaration
public static float4x4 Euler(float x, float y, float z, RotationOrder order = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Single x

The rotation angle around the x-axis in radians.
System.Single y

The rotation angle around the y-axis in radians.
System.Single z

The rotation angle around the z-axis in radians.
RotationOrder order

The order in which the rotations are applied.
Returns
Type Description
float4x4

Euler(float3, RotationOrder)

Declaration
public static float4x4 Euler(float3 xyz, RotationOrder order = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
float3 xyz
RotationOrder order
Returns
Type Description
float4x4

EulerXYZ(Single, Single, Single)

Returns a float4x4 rotation matrix constructed by first performing a rotation around the x-axis, then the y-axis and finally the z-axis. All rotation angles are in radians and clockwise when looking along the rotation axis towards the origin.

Declaration
public static float4x4 EulerXYZ(float x, float y, float z)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Single x

The rotation angle around the x-axis in radians.

The rotation angle around the y-axis in radians.
System.Single z

The rotation angle around the z-axis in radians.
Returns

float4x4

EulerZXY(Single, Single, Single)

Returns a float4x4 rotation matrix constructed by first performing a rotation around the z-axis, then the x-axis and finally the y-axis. All rotation angles are in radians and clockwise when looking along the rotation axis towards the origin. This is the default order rotation order in Unity.

Declaration
public static float4x4 EulerZXY(float x, float y, float z)
Parameters

Returns

LookAt(float3, float3, float3)

Returns a float4x4 view matrix given an eye position, a target point and a unit length up vector. The up vector is assumed to be unit length, the eye and target points are assumed to be distinct and the vector between them is assumes to be collinear with the up vector. If these assumptions are not met use float4x4.LookRotationSafe instead.

Declaration
public static float4x4 LookAt(float3 eye, float3 target, float3 up)
Parameters
Type Name Description
float3 eye
float3 target
float3 up
Returns
Type Description
float4x4

Type Name Description
System.Single verticalFov

Vertical Field of view in radians.

public static float4x4 PerspectiveOffCenter(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Single left

The x-coordinate of the left side of the clipping frustum at the near plane.
System.Single right

The x-coordinate of the right side of the clipping frustum at the near plane.
System.Single bottom

The y-coordinate of the bottom side of the clipping frustum at the near plane.
System.Single top

The y-coordinate of the top side of the clipping frustum at the near plane.

System.Single far
